div.p: Web site diagnostics is performed by setting tracing and logging options and then analyzing the resulting log files.
To perform diagnostics for a web site follow these steps:

ol.li: Set appropriate tracing and logging options – Enable or disable Detailed Error Logging, Failed Request Tracing and Web Server Logging under the Diagnostics section of the web site’s Dashboard management page.
Reproduce the behavior that you would like to diagnose – Navigate to the web site and reproduce the problem or error that you wish to diagnose.

Download log files for the web site – The diagnostic log files are saved to the FTP site specified under the Diagnostic Logs section of the web site’s Dashboard management page. When connecting to the FTP site where the log files are stored you must authenticate using credentials of the account listed under the Deployment User section of the web site’s Dashboard management page, taking care to specify the username with the nomenclature <sitename>\username.
Review the log files for diagnostic information – For information about reading log files for a web site see Analyze your IIS Log Files - Favorite Log Parser Queries.
